snippet: President Hassan Rouhani capped a series of gestures from Iran’s ruling establishment by saying the country would never “seek weapons of mass destruction, including nuclear weapons.”
abstract: Series of goodwill gestures and hints of new diplomatic flexibility from Iran's ruling establishment signals that country's new leaders are pushing for compromise in negotiations over disputed nuclear program; Pres Hassan Rouhani says country would never 'seek weapons of mass destruction, including nuclear weapons.'

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Hassan Rouhani capped a series of gestures from Iran’s ruling establishment by saying the country would never “seek weapons of mass destruction, including nuclear weapons.”

headline.main: Iran’s Leaders Signal Effort at New Thaw
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Leaders Are Signaling A New Thaw
